Articles.Content:
Hypersonic Law Breaker mk 2

Are you tired of seeing the same old boring VTOL/plane hybrids?

Hate how slow a dedicated VTOL is?

Then look no further than the Hypersonic Law Breaker mk2, This absolute beast of a VTOL is capable of 1400+m/s (5000+km/h) in the upper atmosphere and 200m/s in the lower atmosphere, it is completely stable at any fuel level or when firing the horizontal engines and has more than enough torque to spin you the direction you want to go, all that without any added RCS/hidden control surfaces/wings.

Part count: 367

Action groups:

1: Toggle VTOL engines

2: Toggle main thrusters

Download link:

http://www./download/t89s5halssephth/Hypersonic+law+breaker+mk2.craft

On a side note, feel free to remove the shell from this craft, it flies much better without it, just do not expect to be landing it any time soon.

Also you will need to fiddle with both the sets of thrust settings.

As is it is perfectly balanced at all times, if you add/remove weight anywhere it becomes unstable.

The bonus of the outer shell is you can land at around 60m/s with it, you will suvive drops from 100m or so from most angles also.

I did originally want to hide all the internals in a body but it proved to be too heavy to fly at hypersonic speeds.

I do like what i came up with as a replacement, not for looks more for funtion, can land harder on the shell than any leanding gear available.

Edited September 8, 2014 by Roflcopterkklol
Few pictures of this thing from different angles.

So anyone tried this out?

I want to know if it is worth making an SSTO version being that these take a very, very long time to make.
Looks pretty unusual. Can't give you more rep.

Looks pretty unusual. Can't give you more rep.

Yeah it does actually look and fly a lot nicer without the football shell, just cant find a way to land it lol, seem to only be able to bring it down at about 60m/s

Anywho glad you like my designs, a link to my thread if you have not found it, can find all my submissions there.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93252-Roflcopterkklol-All-my-submitted-craft

Edited September 9, 2014 by Roflcopterkklol
